resources.string: Tap the screen to immediately take a screenshot before the countdown ends
Disable \'Use system defaults\' to use this

If this service is enabled, the app can simulate a power+home button press to take screenshots.
On some devices enabling this method may be more stable or faster than the default method.

If you enable the service here, you also need to enable the "native method" in the app settings.
Using default storage directory, format, screenshot editor and notifications
You can also switch it on/off from the quick settings tile
Automatically remove the floating button after you took a screenshot
Show a [X]/close button next to floating button
Lets you remove the floating button without opening the quick settings
Type a text or an emoji that will appear as the close button
A secret phrase to allow other applications (like MacroDroid or Tasker) to initiate screenshots
Use these placeholders in the file name

%timestamp% - time as yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss
 %counter% - counts the number of screenshots
 %random% - a random UUID
 %randint% - a random number
 %package% - package name of the foreground app
Select up to three buttons that appear below the screenshot notification
Please choose a maximum of three buttons
Prevent screenshots if the device is locked
The included photo editor tries to overwrite the current image instead of creating a new file
Choose what happens after the screenshot was taken
View your recent screenshots including files that were not saved to the gallery
Show a \"Toast\" notification. A small popup that disappears after 2 seconds
Show a regular notification. You can change the buttons (Edit,Share,…) below the notification under \"More Settings\"
Open in an external photo editor
Open in a photo viewer or the gallery

Do you want to delete all temporary files?
This will delete all files in %s

(These files are usually not visible in your gallery)
Shows a notification when you have taken a screenshot
Shows a notification when you are taking a screenshot. Prevents the app from being terminated by the battery optimization while a screenshot is in process
Failed to take screenshot, please try again
Failed to acquire permission for storage
Failed to acquire permission to record screen capture
Drag the button into your settings
Take screenshots with the new button
Google Play Prominent Disclosure & Consent Requirement
Google Play requires prominent disclosure of the Accessibility Services API’s use for an app that is not an accessibility tool.
This app - “Screenshot Tile [No root]“ - is not an accessibility tool.

Since users may not reasonably expect that their personal and sensitive user data will be required to provide or improve the policy compliant features or functionality within this app, a prominent disclosure of the usage of the Accessibility Services API by this app and a declaration of the data collection and data sharing within this app is required:
This app requires access to Accessibility Services API in order to take a screenshot when the app is not in use.
Access to Accessibility Services API will allow this app to record the screen.
Screen recordings will be used to create screenshot images.
Data is neither collected nor shared by this app using the accessibility capabilities.
Do you agree to authorize this app to gain access to the Accessibility Services API and to use the accessibility capabilities to record the screen?
For more information and bug reports visit:\ngithub.com/cvzi/ScreenshotTile
Please activate \"%1s\" in the accessibility settings

Before you can use this app, you need to add the tile/button to the quick settings. If you don\'t know how to do this, take a look at the [Tutorial,.TutorialActivity].\n\nThis app supports two different methods to take screenshots:

The legacy method to take screenshots uses the screen recording features of Android.
When you take a screenshot, no sound is played. A silent notification is shown to open, share or edit the screenshot. The notification can be disabled in the app settings.
Before you can take a screenshot you need to add the tile to the quick settings, accept the permission to record the screen and the permission to access the internal storage to save the image file.
See the tutorial on how to do it.

On some phones this method does not work, especially on newer Androids (9.0+) it is unstable and it may ask for permission on every single screenshot. If that happens you should use the native method below.

When you take a screenshot, it may play a sound or show a screenshot editor. Screenshots are stored in the standard folder for pictures. This depends on your phone and cannot be changed by this app. You might be able to change the behavior in your phone\'s settings.

You can change in the app settings (under "Use system defaults") whether you want the default system behaviour of your phone (notifications, screenshot editor, standard folder for pictures) or if you want to use the app\'s settings (a custom storage folder and notifications by this app).

If you have enabled the native method, you can also use a floating button (similar to a chat bubble) to take screenshots.\nYou can enable it with a separate tile/button in the quick settings and then move it around on the screen.
Long pressing the tile/button opens a menu. You can specify a delay for the screenshot or cut out a rectangle from the screen.

If you set this app as your assist app, you can long press the home button to take a screenshot. Enabling this app as your assist app will disable other assistants. You can change the action of the long home button press in the app settings.
If the accessibility settings are grayed out, you will need to allow the \"restricted settings\" first. The \"restricted settings\" can be found in the \"App info\":
New and old file name are identical
Do you want to exit without saving the image?
Delay after tapping the shutter (in "Select area" mode)
Waiting period between the time the shutter was tapped and the screenshot is taken. Use a higher value (for example 500) if the shutter icon was visible on screenshots.
Delay after screenshot permission was granted (applies to "Original method")
Waiting period between the time the permission was granted and the screenshot is taken. Use a higher value (for example 500) if permission dialog was visible on screenshots.

string.name: setting_failed_virtual_display_delay
string.comment: The place holder is the name of the error: `Failed to start virtual display`

resources.string: Waiting period before trying again after the error message. Use a higher value (for example 500) if the error message was visible on screenshots.
Choose a lower value to make the button more transparent. Range 0.0 to 1.0\nDefault: 1.0 (fully-opaque)
Choose a custom delay for the tile (in seconds)
Choose a custom delay for the floating button (in seconds)
Compression/Quality of the file format: (0 to 100)\n0 means compress for the smallest size. 100 means compress for max visual quality.\nLeave empty to use the default value.
Max. number of screenshots to keep in:

string.name: setting_keep_app_data_max_dialog
string.comment: Placeholder is replaced with the translation of `Save image to gallery`

resources.string: If you disabled \"%1$s\", then screenshots are temporarily stored in the \"Android/data/\" folder and periodically deleted when the maximum number of files is reached.\n-1 means keep unlimited\nDefault value %2$s

string.name: setting_keep_screenshot_history_summary
string.comment: Placeholder is replaced with the translation of `Recent screenshots`

resources.string: Stores the file names of screenshots in a list. This is required for the function \"%1$s\"
Show when device is locked (on the lock-screen)
Show floating buttons when quick settings are pulled down
One of the tiles of the app must be added to the quick settings, otherwise the floating button cannot be hidden when the quick settings are pulled down
